laboratory_examinations.findings: White blood cell count: 16.8 × 10^9/L (normal range 4.1–9.8 × 10^9); Neutrophils: 77% (normal range 40–74%); Haematocrit: 46% (normal range 37–47%)
Expanding, heterogeneous, multiloculated mass adjacent to the caecal fundus
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up abdominal CT scan done 72 hours later showed complete resolution of the abnormalities

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduced total haemolytic complement activity (CH50): 3.48 HU/mL (normal range 6.6–16); C1 inhibitor (C1-INH): 6.4 g/dL (normal range 15–35); C4: 0.06 g/L (normal range 0.2–0.4); normal concentrations of C3 and Clq
